keyTakeAways: A former New York state prison guard, Robert Brooks, was beaten multiple times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024, resulting in his death from internal injuries.

David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter, while Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges despite being charged with gang assault and other offenses.

Body-camera footage showing guards pummeling Brooks in silence, with no sound, played a central role in the prosecution's argument and sparked public outrage due to the apparent lack of concern from the officers.
All guards were accused of acting together as a 'gang' and showing 'depraved indifference to human life,' with prosecutor William Fitzpatrick asserting collective responsibility.

Brooks, serving a 12-year sentence for first-degree assault since 2017, was transferred to Marcy Correctional Facility that night and suffered severe injuries including a broken nose, black eye, and internal organ damage.

Six of ten guards indicted in February were charged with murder; five pleaded guilty to manslaughter, one to attempted tampering with evidence; three have agreed to reduced charges and are cooperating.

William Fitzpatrick, acting as special prosecutor after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself, is prosecuting multiple prison-related deaths, including the March 1, 2025, beating of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility.
The case highlights systemic issues in prison oversight, officer conduct, and accountability mechanisms in New York's correctional system.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York prison guard, David Kingsley, was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter in the death of inmate Robert Brooks, who was beaten multiple times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024. The beating, captured on silent body-camera footage, revealed guards inflicting severe injuries including damage to the spleen, liver, and lungs, with the final attack in the infirmary being fatal. While Kingsley was convicted, guards Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges, though both faced charges of gang assault. The prosecution argued all guards acted as a gang with 'depraved indifference to human life,' and the case drew national attention due to the lack of concern shown by officers in the video. The case also underscores broader systemic issues in prison violence, as it is part of a larger pattern involving the fatal beating of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility, currently being prosecuted by the same special prosecutor, William Fitzpatrick. Attorney General Letitia James recused herself due to representing guards in civil litigation, leading to Fitzpatrick's appointment as special prosecutor. Six of ten guards indicted in February have either pleaded guilty or agreed to reduced charges, with a third guard scheduled to go on trial in January.
title: Former New York state prison guard found guilty in death of inmate beaten, 2 others acquitted
